question: What are the benefits of using AWS for software development teams?
options: A. On-demand access to a wide range of cloud infrastructure services
B. Elimination of the need for costly hardware and administrative pain
D. Ability to set up a development and test infrastructure quickly
E. Allocation of resources depending on each project’s needs and budget

question: What type of expenditure is associated with owning hardware and IT infrastructure?
What type of timescale usually applies to development and test teams?
What are the advantages of operating development tools on AWS?
What is the main benefit of using AWS instead of traditional hardware?
What is an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?
options: A. A template that contains a software configuration (operating system, application server, and applications) that you can run on Amazon EC2.
B. A virtual machine over which developers have complete control.
C. An Elastic IP Address that provides a static endpoint to an Amazon EC2 instance.
D. An Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume that persists independently from the life of an instance.
E. An Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) object that is redundantly stored on multiple devices across multiple facilities in an Amazon S3 Region.
answer: A. A template that contains a software configuration (operating system, application server, and applications) that you can run on Amazon EC2.

question: What is the purpose of creating an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance?
options: A. To durably store the data of the version control repository.
B. To quickly recreate an instance without having to reinstall and reconfigure the version control software.
C. To store the repository’s data separately from the host system.
D. To provide a static endpoint to an Amazon EC2 instance.
E. To take point-in-time snapshots of the EBS volume containing the repository data.
answer: B. To quickly recreate an instance without having to reinstall and reconfigure the version control software.

question: How can you achieve durability of the source code repository?
options: A. By creating an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance.
B. By taking point-in-time snapshots of the EBS volume containing the repository data.
C. By storing the repository’s data separately from the host system.
D. By using an Elastic IP Address to provide a static endpoint to an Amazon EC2 instance.
E. By using Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to redundantly store objects on multiple devices across multiple facilities in an Amazon S3 Region.
answer: B. By taking point-in-time snapshots of the EBS volume containing the repository data.

question: What is the maximum storage capacity of an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume?
What are two solutions available when the source code repository grows and requires more storage capacity?
options: A. Provision and attach additional Amazon EBS volumes to the repository instance.
B. Provision a new larger Amazon EBS volume based on a recent snapshot of the existing repository data.
C. Store the repository’s data separately from the host system.
D. Use an Elastic IP Address to provide a static endpoint to an Amazon EC2 instance.
E. Use Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to redundantly store objects on multiple devices across multiple facilities in an Amazon S3 Region.

question: What is the challenge of running tests on AWS?
options: B. Automating the process of running tests
C. Ensuring enough resources are available
D. Initializing test environments with the right software

question: What is the benefit of running tests on AWS?
options: A. Automating the process of running tests
B. Creating tests suites on AWS
C. Allocating a new server, allocating and attaching storage, allocating a database
D. Designing tests suites on AWS

question: What is the challenge with AMI-based deployments?
options: A. Having to define a strategy for managing and maintaining multiple versions of AMIs
B. Automating the process of creating a new AMI
C. Provisioning Amazon EC2 instances from AMIs
D. Instantiating a fully operational database
answer: A. Having to define a strategy for managing and maintaining multiple versions of AMIs

question: What is the benefit of using AWS CloudFormation?
options: A. Creating and deleting a collection of resources together as a single unit
B. Using templates to create and delete a collection of resources
C. Describing a complete test environment running on AWS in a template
D. Editing and managing templates in the same source code repository

question: What is the purpose of using AWS CloudFormation parameters?
options: A. To specify a specific software version to be loaded
B. To create a collection of related AWS resources
C. To provision the full test environment
D. To simulate a bug detected in older versions of the software
answer: A. To specify a specific software version to be loaded

question: What is the main purpose of tests in software development?
options: B. To find issues early in the development phase
C. To reduce the cost of fixing issues
E. To eliminate the need for costly hardware
answer: B. To find issues early in the development phase

question: What are some of the challenges faced by test teams?
options: A. Limited duration of test runs
D. Need for different IT infrastructure

question: What advantages does AWS provide to testers?
options: A. Setting up test environments in minutes
B. Access to a variety of resources
E. Ability to run tests whenever needed

question: What can be used to reduce the cost of fixing issues?
What does AWS offer to help test teams?
options: A. Elimination of the need for costly hardware
B. Access to different instance types
C. Setting up test environments in weeks
E. Ability to run tests whenever needed

question: What is the equivalent of hibernating the operating system when shutting down a development environment?
What happens to the data stored on ephemeral drives when a stop/start sequence is performed?
What is the purpose of terminating an instance?
options: B. Reopen the lid of a laptop

question: What is the DeleteOnTermination flag?
options: A. Used to commit all work
B. Used to save resources and cost
C. Used to delete the root device
E. Used to prevent data loss
answer: C. Used to delete the root device

question: When does the Amazon EBS volume store the state?
options: C. When the DeleteOnTermination flag is set
D. When the instance is recreated from an AMI
E. When the lid of a laptop is reopened

question: What is the primary use of a local laptop or desktop for developers?
options: A. To install and maintain specialized sets of tools
B. To run the development environment
answer: B. To run the development environment

question: What is the benefit of using an on-demand development environment hosted in AWS?
options: A. It is easy to switch context
B. It is easy to set up collections of AWS resources
C. It is easy to set up test environments

question: What is the concept of hosted desktops not limited to?
What does Amazon VPC allow?
options: C. To extend the on-premise private network to the cloud
D. To install and maintain specialized sets of tools
answer: C. To extend the on-premise private network to the cloud

question: What is discussed further in the Testing section?
options: B. Using an on-demand development environment
C. Installing and maintaining specialized sets of tools
E. Extending the on-premise private network to the cloud

question: What is the purpose of creating separate accounts for development and test activities?
options: A. To help customers understand the development and test cycle
B. To separate teams and responsibilities
E. To organize and track AWS costs
answer: B. To separate teams and responsibilities

question: What does AWS offer to enable sharing of resources across accounts?
answer: A. Amazon S3 objects, B. AMIs, C. Amazon EBS Snapshots

question: What are some options to separate out and allocate the cost for the various activities and phases of the development and test cycle?
options: C. Use the Cost Allocation Report
D. Organize and track AWS costs
E. Represent the various stages or teams of the development cycle
answer: A. Use separate accounts, B. Consolidate multiple accounts, C. Use the Cost Allocation Report

question: What is the purpose of resource tagging?
options: A. To help customers understand the development and test cycle
B. To separate teams and responsibilities
E. To organize and track AWS costs
answer: E. To organize and track AWS costs

question: What are some dimensions that can be used when using resource tagging?
options: E. Various stages or teams of the development cycle
answer: E. Various stages or teams of the development cycle

question: What are some services that are inherently fault-tolerant?
options: A. Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, and Amazon RDS
B. Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon SimpleDB, Amazon SQS, Amazon Route 53, and Amazon CloudFront
C. Amazon VPC, Security Groups, and IAM credentials
D. Amazon CloudWatch and AWS SDKs
E. AWS CloudFormation stacks and other automation techniques
answer: B. Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon SimpleDB, Amazon SQS, Amazon Route 53, and Amazon CloudFront
